title: A1932 EMC3814
message:
Hi,

Apologies I can't seem to find the board number. Client has liquid damage.  She said was WAS turning on so she took to Apple for a checkup, they told her to replace entire unit and now the unit does not turn on at all.  I have examined the board, there was a lot of water in the macbook but the board seems OK visually.  On the touchpad there was a little corrosion which could be the cause of the issues (assuming the On button runs through the KB as in the past.

Obviously without a board number I can't get a schematic or provide any useful info to you!

Where might I find a board number?

title: A1932 EMC3814
message:
[URL unfurl="true"]https://www.google.com/search?client=firefox-b-d&bih=866&biw=1680&hl=es&sxsrf=ALeKk02WmHsPZISAUQflu36iTd4q0sCp9Q%3A1594804887583&ei=l8oOX9SVI6OGjLsP3bu5yAs&q=A1932+EMC3814+logic+board&oq=A1932+EMC3814+logic+board&gs_lcp=CgZwc3ktYWIQAzoRCAAQsAMQigMQtwMQ5QIQiwM6BwghEAoQoAE6BAghEBU6BgghEAoQFVCj4PgnWM74-Cdg_fr4J2gBcAB4AIABa4gBpgiSAQQxMi4xmAEAoAECoAEBqgEHZ3dzLXdpergBAg&sclient=psy-ab&ved=0ahUKEwiUvb2W987qAhUjA2MBHd1dDrkQ4dUDCAs&uact=5[/URL]

Is it 820-01521?

Did Apple say it is not under warranty?
Be sure of that before start the repair.

title: A1932 EMC3814
message:
HI

Sorry I am not sure I understand your question. 

The device may be under Apple original warranty period but is now void due to water damage, or is there something here I do not understand?

Apple have told her to replace the entire logic board at her cost.

Cheers

James

title: A1932 EMC3814
message:
Did you try the board alone on the desk?
Use only charger, nothing else connected and check if voltages appear on the big coils.
